author: Christopher Simpson
title: Chelsea Transfer News: Latest Rumours on Tiemoue Bakayoko and Michael Keane
text:
88% Squawka Bakayoko is a physical powerhouse and an expert in breaking up play —he'd arguably be an upgrade on Matic in terms of his defensive contribution, albeit he isn't as creative. Alongside compatriot Kante, he could help give Chelsea perhaps the most robust midfield pairing in the Premier League, but Monaco's resistance to losing all of their best players could prevent the deal happening in the immediate future. Nigel Roddis/Getty Images Meanwhile, per Metro 's Tom Olver , Burnley defender Michael Keane is concentrating on the remainder of the season with the Clarets rather than a possible move to Chelsea or Liverpool in the summer: 
It’s flattering [to be linked], but I'm focused on Burnley. 
We've got nine games left in the season and we need to make sure we remain in the league. But to see things like that can only mean you’re playing well. 
I always thought that I was going to make it at [Manchester] United so when I left, I felt like I had a point to prove. The defender impressed as Burnley drew with Chelsea in February, per Bleacher Report UK's Sam Tighe: Sam Tighe @stighefootball Michael Keane a good choice for MotM. Continuing his brilliant season. Marshalled Diego Costa really well. He's legitimately really good. His excellent form saw him rewarded with his first England cap against Germany on Wednesday. Match of the Day host and former Three Lions star Gary Lineker believes he fared well: Gary Lineker @GaryLineker 3/22/2017, 8:24:58 PM The 24-year-old has been excellent throughout the campaign with Burnley, so it would not be a surprise if he were to be cherry-picked this summer by a more illustrious outfit. Chelsea's defence is already the meanest in the top flight alongside Tottenham Hotspur , but Keane could make for a strong long-term replacement for Gary Cahill. Like the new article format? !
